  • Element
com.graywolf336.jail.command

Annotation Type CommandInfo


  • public @interface CommandInfo

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      int maxArgs
      Gets the maximum amount of arguments required, -1 if no maximum (ex: Jailing someone with a reason or editing a reason).
      int minimumArgs
      Gets the minimum amount of arguments required.
      boolean needsPlayer
      Whether the command needs a player context or not.
      java.lang.String pattern
      A regex pattern that allows for alternatives to the command (ex: /jail or /j, /jailstatus or /js).
      java.lang.String permission
      Gets the permission required to execute this command.
      java.lang.String usage
      Gets the usage message for this command.

    • Element Detail

      • maxArgs

        public abstract int maxArgs
        Gets the maximum amount of arguments required, -1 if no maximum (ex: Jailing someone with a reason or editing a reason).
        Returns:
        The maximum number of arguments required, -1 if no maximum.

      • minimumArgs

        public abstract int minimumArgs
        Gets the minimum amount of arguments required.
        Returns:
        The minimum number of arguments required.

      • needsPlayer

        public abstract boolean needsPlayer
        Whether the command needs a player context or not.
        Returns:
        True if requires a player, false if not.

      • pattern

        public abstract java.lang.String pattern
        A regex pattern that allows for alternatives to the command (ex: /jail or /j, /jailstatus or /js).
        Returns:
        The regex pattern to match.

      • permission

        public abstract java.lang.String permission
        Gets the permission required to execute this command.
        Returns:
        The permission required.

      • usage

        public abstract java.lang.String usage
        Gets the usage message for this command.
        Returns:
        The usage message.
